title: CSS Pseudo-classes
subject: CSS
theory:
A pseudo-class is used to define a special state of an element.

They can be used to:
*   Style an element when a user mouses over it.
*   Style visited and unvisited links differently.
*   Style an element when it gets focus.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between :nth-child() and :nth-of-type()?
interview_questions.answer: :nth-child counts ALL children. :nth-of-type counts only children of that specific tag type.
